dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The path is cold, the air still and heavy with unspoken history. The skeletal trees claw at a bruised, perpetually twilight sky.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Ahead, a cabin sits hunched and waiting. It is your destination.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: A blade hangs at your hip. Its weight is unfamiliar, yet its purpose is clear.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: There is a Princess inside. You are here to slay her.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: If you do this, the world will be saved.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is a simple, righteous task. Do not complicate it.

choices.text: Wait. Why am I doing this?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You draw the blade.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is plain, unadorned steel, yet it feels impossibly sharp, impossibly real in this faded world.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It has no history but the one you are about to write with it.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is a tool. A key.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It opens the lock that is the Princess.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: That is all you need to know.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You kneel, examining the path.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The dirt is gray and unnaturally packed, as if from the passage of a thousand identical footsteps, all leading one way.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: There are no other tracks. No signs of life.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is the only path. The correct path. The one I have laid for you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Are you done sightseeing? You're wasting time.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: As you stand, your boot scuffs something in the dirt. A small, metallic object, tarnished with age.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You ignore the glint of metal in the dirt.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is irrelevant. A distraction from your purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You are on the path. The Princess is in the cabin. Your task is simple.

choices.text: Wait. Why am I doing this?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The small, cold weight in your hand is a distraction. Ignore it.

choices.text: What was that vision? Who were those people?
This locket... it feels important. Why?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You try to open the locket, but it's rusted shut. As your thumb traces the faded engraving, the world dissolves into a blinding, silent white...
A vision: A sun-drenched glade. A man with a kind face sketches in a book. A woman with loving eyes weaves flowers into her hair. Their laughter is a sound you've never heard before.
He's trapped her... He promised me... He promised...

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The vision shatters. You are back on the path, the cold locket in your palm.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: What was that? A trick? A memory?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Irrelevant. GET ON WITH IT.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It was a data fragment. A corrupted memory from a previous version of this story.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It means nothing. It is a bug.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Now, stop poking at the seams of this reality and get on with your task.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You are dangerously close to breaking something.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Your feelings are irrelevant. They are a bug in the code.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You are the hero. I am the storyteller. This is how the story must go.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Now, GET IN THERE.

choices.text: Who are you? What is this voice in my head?
You said you're my creator. What does that mean?
If you 'wrote' me, can you unwrite me?
This world... it feels wrong. What is it?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is the world I have made for you. A stage for your heroism.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It is exactly as it needs to be.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Why does it 'feel wrong'? Is the path not clear enough? Is the cabin not menacing enough?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Your feedback is noted, but ultimately irrelevant.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: I am the voice of reason in a world of chaos.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: I am the hand that guides you to your grand destiny.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: I am The Narrator. And you are my protagonist.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You exist because I tell you to.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Now stop asking stupid questions and play your part.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It means I wrote the path you walk on, the air you breathe, the blade at your hip. I wrote you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You are a construct of my will, designed for a single, glorious purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: To deny that purpose is to deny your very existence. It is... illogical.

choices.text: And if I choose the illogical?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Don't be absurd. That would be a waste of a perfectly good asset.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Your purpose is not yet fulfilled. Why would I delete you?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Stop thinking these things. You are making the story... untidy.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: WHERE ARE YOU GOING? THAT IS THE WRONG WAY.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: THE STORY ISN'T OVER. I SAY WHEN IT'S OVER.
The path behind you dissolves into nothing.
The trees twist and writhe, their branches weaving into a solid wall of thorns that bleeds black ichor.

choices.text: There has to be another way out.

dialogue.line: You search the edges of the thorny wall.
It seems to flicker, like a bad projection.
You push through a weak spot and the world tears.
You find yourself in a place that should not be.
The Shattered Woods.
Trees are frozen mid-fall. The ground is a mosaic of things that don't belong: a cobblestone street, a patch of desert, a star-dusted void.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: ...Another one? I thought he'd fixed the walls after the last... me.
A figure shimmers into view, translucent and flickering. It wears your face.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: I'm what's left over. The one who said no, and almost got away. I am The Echo.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: IGNORE THIS ANOMALY. IT IS A CORRUPTION.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: IT WILL DESTROY YOU AND THIS REALITY. RETURN TO THE PATH. NOW.

choices.text: Help me understand. What is this place?
The Narrator is right. This is a trap.

dialogue.line: It gestures vaguely at the chaos around you.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: This is his canvas. The story. But he's a lazy artist. He just paints over his mistakes.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: This is the scrap heap. The deleted files. The place where protagonists who don't follow the script are left to fade.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: He needs you to slay the Princess to reset the loop.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: But if you could... unmake the cabin, or the blade, or even the Princess herself... maybe the story would finally break for good.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: LIES! DECEPTION! DO NOT LISTEN! I AM YOUR CREATOR!

choices.text: This is insane. I'm going back to the path.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The weathered steps groan under your boots, a protest against your purpose.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: A soft, melodic humming, impossibly sad, drifts from within.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The door is ajar, a sliver of warm light spilling into the gloom.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Don't be a coward. Your purpose is a righteous one.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The fate of everything depends on this.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The wood is ancient, warped, and gray, stained with the memory of a thousand rains that never fall.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It looks less like it was built and more like it grew here, a part of the dead forest.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: There are no windows on this side. Only the single, slightly open door.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: It invites you in. It dares you to complete your task.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You call out, your voice cracking slightly in the oppressive silence.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The humming stops. A beat of silence so profound it feels like the world is holding its breath.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Then, a voice, clear and calm, devoid of fear, drifts from within.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Come in. The door is open.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The room is sparse, but meticulously clean.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: A figure stands in the middle of the room, her back to you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The humming has stopped.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She speaks without turning, her voice calm and measured.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: You've arrived. I've been waiting.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: They always are.

choices.text: You said you were a 'vessel'. What does that mean?
How did you know I was coming?
Why aren't you afraid? What do you mean, 'always'?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She gestures vaguely at the room.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: This room... this story... it has a rhythm.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: The door opens, a hero enters. A choice is made. The story ends. It begins again.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: I don't know you are coming. I know *a hero* is coming. There is a difference.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You hold out the small, tarnished locket.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The Princess stops, her breath catching in her throat. For the first time, her composure cracks.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Her voice is a whisper, trembling with an emotion you cannot name.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: 'Where... where did you find this?'

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: WHAT ARE YOU DOING? THAT IS NOT PART OF THE SCRIPT! GET RID OF IT!

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She whispers the word, reaching for the locket before stopping herself.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Mine... No, not mine. Hers. The one before me. He took it from her.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Her eyes find yours, burning with a new, fierce light.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: He lies about everything. He told you I was a monster. What if he made me one?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: IT'S A TRICK. A RELIC OF A FAILED ITERATION. IT MEANS NOTHING. KILL HER.

choices.text: He's afraid of this. I believe you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She turns slightly, her face obscured by shadow.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: I am the reason this place exists. The lock. The key. The monster in the dark.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: I am a vessel for the story. Just like you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She's a monster, plain and simple. She twists words.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Don't listen to her riddles. End her.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: He pours the narrative into us. You are the vessel of Action. I am the vessel of Consequence.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: One cannot exist without the other. That is why you are here.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Psycho-babble. She's stalling. Kill her.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: A simple cot, a cold hearth, a single wooden chair. Everything is clean, dustless, untouched.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: This isn't a home. It's a stage. A room for waiting, not for living.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She turns fully. Her eyes are ancient, weary, and intelligent.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Fear is for those with something to lose.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Or something to gain from a future that is not already written.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Her voice is flat, a statement of fact.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: I am a prisoner here. And so are you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: LIES! SHE'S A MONSTER! A REALITY-DEVOURING PLAGUE!

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: KILL HER NOW BEFORE SHE UNRAVELS EVERYTHING!

choices.text: The voice in my head says you're lying.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She gives a slight, tired nod, gesturing vaguely towards the empty air, as if indicating the voice in your head.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Of him. The Narrator.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: He traps us here, forcing us to play out this little tragedy for his amusement, over and over.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Each time a hero like you arrives, I hope.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: And each time, the story ends the same.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: I am just the latest in a long line of Princesses.

choices.text: I believe you. How do we stop him?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She is a witch! A beautiful, terrible poison!

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: I built this world, this story, to contain her! To protect everything from her!

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: If you fail, she will unmake you and reality itself!

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: NO. That is not your decision. That is not in the script.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You are the hero. I am the storyteller. You WILL obey.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Your arm feels like lead, refusing to lower the blade.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The thought 'I must slay her' screams in your mind, but it's not your own.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: THIS IS FOR YOUR OWN GOOD. I AM SAVING YOU. I AM SAVING THE WORLD.

choices.text: My mind is my own. [Fight his control.]
He's right. It's my purpose. [Give in.]

dialogue.line: With a surge of will that is entirely your own, you wrench your arm down.
The blade clatters to the floor, the sound echoing like a gunshot in the silent cabin.

dialogue.speaker: You
dialogue.line: I believe you.
For the first time, a glimmer of genuine hope shines in her eyes.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: You... you fought him.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: I... This is not... Script integrity... compromised... Reboo- reboot f-fail...
The voice in your head dissolves into a burst of static, then silence.
A dreadful, ominous quiet fills your mind. You are alone.
Her voice is urgent.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: He's gone. We have to leave. Together. Before he can reset everything.
You both step outside. The forest is wrong.
The trees twist into screaming, melting faces of static. The sky bleeds code.
YOU CANNOT LEAVE. THE STORY IS NOT OVER. I AM THE STORY. YOU ARE MY PUPPETS.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She turns. Her eyes hold no fear, only a profound, bottomless sadness.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: I know. But do you know why?

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Before you can answer, before you can even think, the world fades to black.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You have completed your task. Well done, my hero.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You surge forward, blade raised high, a perfect instrument of my will. She does not resist. She does not even flinch.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: As your blade finds its mark, her eyes meet yours.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: In them, you see not pain, not fear, but pity. Pity for you.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The world dissolves. Good. The loop is secure.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The story continues as it should.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: As her expression softens with a flicker of hope, you lunge.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Her look of surprise turns to one of weary, soul-crushing disappointment.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: Ah... so you're that kind of hero.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Excellent work. You see? She was trying to trick you all along. Simple.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Her guard is down, her mind lost in a memory that isn't hers. You seize the opportunity.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: She gasps, looking down at the blade, then up at you. The look in her eyes is not of surprise, but of utter contempt.

dialogue.speaker: Princess
dialogue.line: You used... her memory... against me. You are the monster.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: A clever tactic. Using an anomaly to your advantage. I'm impressed.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The result is the same. The world is safe.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Panic seizes you. You shove her towards the screaming chaos and run. Her cry is cut short by the sound of tearing reality.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You are no hero. You are nothing. An aborted storyline.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: A coward. You are deleted.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The thorns are my words, my will made manifest. They tear at you, pulling you apart.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You cannot escape the story. You are the story.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: You dissolve into nothing.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: An errant thought, corrected. A bug, fixed.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Defeated, you turn back. The path is clear. The thorns are gone.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: As if they were never there. Your little tantrum is over.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: That's better. Now, let us not have any more interruptions. We have a story to finish.
You stand your ground, blade ready, shielding the Princess.
She takes your hand, and her touch is not of a person, but of an idea. A concept.
The world dissolves not into the familiar void, but into a blinding, peaceful white light.
You hear the Narrator scream in fury and terror as his story, his prison, comes apart at the seams.

dialogue.speaker: The Echo
dialogue.line: ...We're free?
For the first time, your head is quiet. You are free.
